Package scheduler.tools

Class Fetcher

java.lang.Object
scheduler.tools.Fetcher
public class Fetcher
extends java.lang.Object
Version:
1.0 Contains methods to query/fetch data from the database. It is not used for modifying/deleting the database.
Author:
Brayden McArthur
See Also:
for methods to modify/delete in the database.

    Fetches the next available ID from a given table by sorting the list of all Customer_ID's and looping through to find the next available ID.

    Provided a country name as a String value, finds the associated country ID, which can then be used to find a specific first level division since the country ID is a Foreign key in the first_level_divisions table.

  • Method Details

    • fetchTableSize

      public int fetchTableSize​(java.lang.String table) throws java.lang.Exception
      Gets the number of records in a table.
      Parameters:
      table - A string representing a table in the database.
      Returns:
      Returns the number of records in the specified table as an integer.
      Throws:
      java.lang.Exception - Throws Exception if there is an error with the database.

    • fetchCustomers

      public void fetchCustomers​(javafx.collections.ObservableList<Customer> customerList) throws java.lang.Exception
      Used in conjunction with the customer object to create an ObservableList of all current Customers in the database. Reads in the customers from the database and creates a Customer object from each row. The Customer objects are then appended to an ObservableList of Customers provided by the caller function
      Parameters:
      customerList - An ObservableList of Customers where the set of customers from the database will be stored.
      Throws:
      java.lang.Exception - Throws Exception if there is an error with the database.

    • fetchAppointments

      public void fetchAppointments​(javafx.collections.ObservableList<Appointment> appointmentList) throws java.lang.Exception
      Creates ObservableList of all current Appointments in the database. Reads in the Appointments from the database and creates an Appointment object from each row. The Appointment objects are then appended to an ObservableList of Appointments provided by the caller function.
      Parameters:
      appointmentList - An ObservableList of Appointments where the set of appointments from the database will be stored.
      Throws:
      java.lang.Exception - Throws Exception if there is an error with the database.

    • fetchAppointmentsWeek

      public void fetchAppointmentsWeek​(javafx.collections.ObservableList<Appointment> appointmentList) throws java.lang.Exception
      Creates an ObservableList of all Appointments in the database that have Start times occurring within 1 week from today's date. The Appointments are then appended to an ObservableList of Appointments provided by the caller function.
      Parameters:
      appointmentList - An ObservableList of Appointments where the set of appointments from the database will be stored.
      Throws:
      java.lang.Exception - Throws Exception if there is an error in the database.

    • fetchAppointmentsMonth

      public void fetchAppointmentsMonth​(javafx.collections.ObservableList<Appointment> appointmentList) throws java.lang.Exception
      Creates an ObservableList of all Appointments in the database that have Start times occurring within 1 month from today's date. The Appointments are then appended to an ObservableList of Appointments provided by the caller function.
      Parameters:
      appointmentList - An ObservableList of Appointments where the set of appointments from the database will be stored.
      Throws:
      java.lang.Exception - Throws Exception if there is an error in the database.

    • fetchAllIds

      public javafx.collections.ObservableList<java.lang.Integer> fetchAllIds​(java.lang.String table, java.lang.String column) throws java.lang.Exception
      Fetches the next available ID from a given table by sorting the list of all Customer_ID's and looping through to find the next available ID.
      Parameters:
      table - A string containing the table name.
      column - A string containing the column name.
      Returns:
      Returns the next available ID as an integer.
      Throws:
      java.lang.Exception - Throws Exception if there is an error in the database.

    • fetchCountries

      public javafx.collections.ObservableList<java.lang.String> fetchCountries() throws java.lang.Exception
      Creates an ObservableList of strings containing all country names from the database.
      Returns:
      Returns an ObservableList of strings. The values are the names of all countries in the database
      Throws:
      java.lang.Exception - Throws Exception if there is an error in the database.

    • fetchDivisions

      public javafx.collections.ObservableList<java.lang.String> fetchDivisions​(java.lang.String country) throws java.lang.Exception
      Provided a country name as a String value, finds the associated country ID, which can then be used to find a specific first level division since the country ID is a Foreign key in the first_level_divisions table.
      Parameters:
      country - A string representing a country name.
      Returns:
      Returns an ObservableList of strings of all first level divisions associated with the given country name.
      Throws:
      java.lang.Exception - Throws Exception if there is an error in the database.

    • fetchDivisionId

      public int fetchDivisionId​(java.lang.String division) throws java.lang.Exception
      Gets the First Level Division ID given a Division Name.
      Parameters:
      division - A string representing a Division Name.
      Returns:
      Returns an integer representing the associated Division ID.
      Throws:
      java.lang.Exception - Throws Exception if there is an error in the database.

    • fetchDivisionDetails

      public Division fetchDivisionDetails​(int divisionId) throws java.lang.Exception
      Given a Division ID, creates a Division object and sets the attributes to the corresponding attributes found in the database.
      Parameters:
      divisionId - A Division ID from a Customer object.
      Returns:
      Returns a Division object.
      Throws:
      java.lang.Exception - Throws Exception if there is an error in the database.

      public javafx.collections.ObservableList<Contact> fetchAllContacts() throws java.lang.Exception

      Returns:
      Returns an ObservableList of Contacts.
      Throws:
      java.lang.Exception - Throws Exception if there is an error in the database.

      Parameters:
      id - An integer representing a Contact ID.
      Returns:
      Returns a string representing the associated Contact Name.
      Throws:
      java.lang.Exception - Throws Exception if there is an error in the database.

    • validateCustomerId

      public boolean validateCustomerId​(int id) throws java.lang.Exception
      Checks whether a Customer ID is in the database.
      Parameters:
      id - An integer representing a Customer ID.
      Returns:
      Returns True if the Customer ID exists in the associated table and column. False if not.
      Throws:
      java.lang.Exception - Throws Exception if there is an error in the database.

    • validateUserId

      public boolean validateUserId​(int id) throws java.lang.Exception
      Validates the user id provided by the user
      Parameters:
      id - a whole number provided by the user
      Returns:
      true if the id exists in the associated table and column. False if not.
      Throws:
      java.lang.Exception - Throws Exception if there is an error in the database.

    • fetchTotalByType

      public int fetchTotalByType​(java.lang.String type) throws java.lang.Exception
      Gets the total number of Appointments for a given Appointment Type.
      Parameters:
      type - A string representing an Appointment Type.
      Returns:
      Returns an integer representing the total number of Appointments of the given Type.
      Throws:
      java.lang.Exception - Throws Exception if there is an error in the database.

    • getCurrentUserId

      public int getCurrentUserId​(java.lang.String dbUsername, java.lang.String dbPassword) throws java.lang.Exception
      If the username and password are correct, this method is called and sets the User object in this program to the user id, username, and password found in the corresponding row of the database. The purpose of storing this info into a User object in the program is to be able to track what user from the database is responsible for creating and updating customers/appointments.
      Parameters:
      dbUsername - A string value containing a username.
      dbPassword - A string value containing the password that goes with the provided username.
      Returns:
      Returns an integer containing the User ID associated with the username and password.
      Throws:
      java.lang.Exception - Throws Exception if there is an error in the database.

    • validateUsername

      public java.lang.String validateUsername​(java.lang.String username) throws java.lang.Exception
      Compares the username provided by the user in the TextField to the list of usernames in the database. If the username is found in the database, the username has been validated.
      Parameters:
      username - A string containing a username.
      Returns:
      Returns a string containing the username from the database.
      Throws:
      java.lang.Exception - Throws Exception if there is an error in the database.

    • validatePassword

      public java.lang.String validatePassword​(java.lang.String username) throws java.lang.Exception
      Checks that the user provided username/password is a match in the database. If it is, the user can be logged in to use the program. If not, an alert box is displayed.
      Parameters:
      username - A string containing a username.
      Returns:
      Returns a string containing the password from the database.
      Throws:
      java.lang.Exception - Throws Exception if there is an error in the database.
